acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "solid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on the classification by NTP (2005) (R: Lead and Lead Compounds), IARC (1987) (Group 2B: Lead and Inorganic Lead Compounds) and the Japan Society of Occupational Health (2B: Lead Compounds (Inorganic).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: May cause long lasting harmful effects to aquatic life
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since although acute toxicity is not reported within the aqueous solubility concentrations, it was a metallic compound, and  the underwater action was unknown, it was classified into Category 4.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on many reports on the occupational exposure to lead compounds and the results of epidemiological studies: lead compounds induce chromosome aberration and micronucleated cells in human peripheral blood cells (SCE formation is also observed). Although no data are available on the evaluation of lead oxides per se, the results of epidemiological studies should be taken into account in view of their human germ cell mutagenicity. However, classification may not be possible, if based on the description in IARC 23 (1980): data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests, germ/somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo and germ/somatic cell genotoxicity tests in vivo are not available, and in vitro mutagenicity tests do not show strong positive results (in several indexes).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to the absence of data, though being inorganic compounds containing oxygen.

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: May damage fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on the description in IARC 23 (1980): The results of epidemiological studies conducted at lead smelters suggest a significant increase in spontaneous abortion rates. (Workers in lead smelters may be exposed to lead fume, which is probably lead monoxide.)

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale:
No data available
Refer to other data on lead and its compounds (primarily inorganic lead)

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests (CERI Hazard Data 2001-9 (2002)) "mild irritation". Refer to other data on lead and its compounds (primarily inorganic lead)

skin_sensitizer.rationale:
No data available. 
Refer to other data on lead and its compounds (primarily organic lead)

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (blood system, nervous system, kidney)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on human evidence including "the substance induces eye/skin/respiratory irritation and induces chemical bronchitis, pneumonia and pulmonary edema through inhalation of vapor" (ICSC (J) (2002)).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
